published_attributes.title: Purpose of the training
published_attributes.serialized_body:
In this training we would like to familiarise you with the most crucial Security Policies. The purpose is to:

  • To present the nutshell of Security Policies
  • To ensure that all Netgurals are acknowledged with Security Policies essentials
  • To spread the security awareness
  • To ensure compliance with ISO 27001
  • To be sure that we are compliant with the law regulations
  • But the most important, to protect our working environment

We hope that knowledge presented to you will be helpful and not too much overwhelming.

Yours, Security Team:)

draft_attributes.title: Agenda

published_attributes.title: How to navigate across the training
published_attributes.serialized_body:
In each section of the agenda you will find links to necessary security policies. Please make sure you read them before taking a test, as you will need this knowledge to pass it successfully. Please, be aware that when you see answers with squares instead of circles, there may be few possible answers.

Estimated time that you should prepare for the test is 20-30 minutes but, if needed, there is a possibility to go back to the training even after closing it. The required score to pass is 80%. But don't worry - if you fail, you can retake the test multiple times.

published_attributes.title: 1. Security basics - What you should know
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Please check out our security policies below. They will help you to understand basics of the security in Netguru and will let you go smoothly through the test questions that will appear after each section.

  • Laptop Security Policy
  • Mobile devices Security Policy
  • Password Security Policy
  • Using company laptop for private purposes
  • Portable/removable storage/media devices Security Policy
  • Electronic Mail Security Policy
  • Purchasing new licenses, subscriptions & tools

answers.body: Let him print the documents, we have security system that won't allow for infecting the company system in the critical case
Ask him politely to print outside of the company, as plugged in external devices might be infected
Let him print the documents but only with your assistance
If the situation is urgent it is safer to ask the delivery man to send the document to your email - external device plugged in to any company device may cause much more harm

published_attributes.title: If the delivery man asks you to use his portable device to print delivery documents you should:

answers.body: Let him print the documents, we have security system that won't allow for infecting the company system in the critical case
Ask him politely to print outside of the company, as plugged in external devices might be infected
Let him print the documents but only with your assistance
If the situation is urgent it is safer to ask the delivery man to send the document to your email - external device plugged in to any company device may cause much more harm

answers.body: Send the password in one email, along with the invitation - it is easier to be found by the participants
Send the password in the separate email without encryption - this way is much more secure than sending it in one email
Place the password for the meeting in 1Password Team Vault and inform participants where they can find it
Place the password for the meeting in 1Password Private Vault and inform participants where they can find it

published_attributes.title: When you are creating a meeting with password (for example on Zoom), you should:

answers.body: Send the password in one email, along with the invitation - it is easier to be found by the participants
Send the password in the separate email without encryption - this way is much more secure than sending it in one email
Place the password for the meeting in 1Password Team Vault and inform participants where they can find it
Place the password for the meeting in 1Password Private Vault and inform participants where they can find it

draft_attributes.title: When you are creating a meeting with password (for example on Zoom), you should:

answers.body: Only create a ticket on Jira - this is the only thing i have to do
Have a Team Manager approval before creating a ticket
Follow the Purchasing new licenses, subscriptions & tools guide
Have a finance/budget approval before creating a ticket

published_attributes.title: If I want to use a paid tool or application for improving my job I should:

answers.body: Only create a ticket on Jira - this is the only thing i have to do
Have a Team Manager approval before creating a ticket
Follow the Purchasing new licenses, subscriptions & tools guide
Have a finance/budget approval before creating a ticket

draft_attributes.title: If I want to use a paid tool or application for improving my job I should:

answers.body: Check if the tool already exists in tools verified by security
If the tool is not indicated in tools verified by security I should check if the Licence or Terms of Service allow for a commercial use
If the tool is not indicated in tools verified by security I should check if Privacy Policy will not cause harm to the security of Netguru - e.g. Note that all data processed will be publicly visible
Create a ticket according to Purchasing new licenses, subscriptions & tools guide

published_attributes.title: If I want to use opensource or free tool I should:

answers.body: Check if the tool already exists in tools verified by security
If the tool is not indicated in tools verified by security I should check if the Licence or Terms of Service allow for a commercial use
If the tool is not indicated in tools verified by security I should check if Privacy Policy will not cause harm to the security of Netguru - e.g. Note that all data processed will be publicly visible
Create a ticket according to "Getting new tools, subscriptions & licenses" guide

draft_attributes.title: If I want to use opensource or free tool I should:

answers.body: No, it is strictly forbidden
Yes, but I have to ask the Security Team first
Yes, but only from trusted, legal sources

published_attributes.title: Can I download games on my company laptop?

answers.body: No, it is strictly forbidden
Yes, but I have to ask the Security Team first
Yes, but only from trusted, legal sources

answers.body: A clear description of services and service level agreement should be defined
An information if personal data is being processed should be taken into consideration
A confidentiality assurance should be included
Responsibilities and liabilities along with the terms of contract termination should be defined
Each agreement has to be verified by the Legal Team

published_attributes.title: Before signing contract with a 3rd party (e.g. vendor):

answers.body: A clear description of services and service level agreement should be defined
An information if personal data is being processed should be taken into consideration
A confidentiality assurance should be included
Responsibilities and liabilities along with the terms of contract termination should be defined
Each agreement has to be verified by the Legal Team

published_attributes.title: Restricted information is understood as technical, technological or organizational information in Netguru not exposed to public or other information having commercial value, while the entrepreneur has taken the necessary action to maintain its confidentiality.

answers.body: True
False

answers.body: Owner of a restricted information provides a permission for sharing via email or Slack
The Non-Disclosure Agreement has been signed with person or entity
There is a verbal permission from the owner of a restricted information
It is never possible to share restricted information outside of the company
